name: Pommes Frites
address: 128 MacDougal St, New York, NY 10012, USA

reviews.text: Love love the fries here amazing ! Recommend poutine !
These are hands down the best fries I've ever had. It's tasty and fresh. The dipping sauces were really delicious too. They are generous with the tasting samples. Highly recommend!
This place was a 5 but they changed the gravy to a veg one and itâ€™s not good at all. Disappointed
Great fries and choices of sauces. Limited seating so more of a take out than in-dining.
So delicious and the inside of the building definitely gives old Belgian vibes.

This place has rightfully earned its spot at the top. The essential attribute is the employees' friendly approach. This spot is remarkable in every way. I happily cleaned every plate served. This place leaves me wanting to come back.

Another hit from the book One Food Wonders. It's all frites, frites, frites. The only question when you walk in is what sauce do I want with my frites and let me tell you it is not an easy one. Luckily with the amount of frites, even a small, you can pick 2 or 3 sauces and still get a good feel for all of them. I went with the Roasted Garlic Aioli. And in case you are wondering the holes in the tables are where you put the frites cones.
Must stop!!! Delicious
Great pit stop for tasty fries! Lots of dipping sauces it was hard to choose just a few. Huge portions and the fries came out piping hot, not too salty. Delicious!

I ordered online,  fries is tasteless
And drink is extremely sweet!

I have been running a traditional Belgian frituur â€œOmaâ€™s Fritâ€ for 15 years ğŸ‡§ğŸ‡ª. I walked in here out of pure curiosity, because Belgian fries are not just food â€” theyâ€™re a network of tradition and perfection, built over generations.
The secret to real Belgian fries lies in the quality and variety of the potatoes, the type of fat used, and precise control of temperature and frying time. Even how many potatoes are added to the fryer at once makes a difference: if you add too many, the temperature suddenly drops, which immediately affects the texture.
A powerful fryer, the right fat, and especially the double-frying method with correct temperatures and timings are absolutely crucial.
In Belgium, potatoes are delivered fresh every day, and we mostly use Bintje potatoes because of their unique flavor and structure. Occasionally we switch to Agria, but nothing truly compares to good Bintjes.
With all that in mind, I was curious to give this place a try. I walked inâ€¦ and honestly, I walked back out rather quickly. The bar for fries in Belgium is simply very high, and what I saw here didnâ€™t reach that level.

This is not meant as negative criticism, just an honest observation: real friesâ€¦ thatâ€™s something truly Belgian. ğŸ‡§ğŸ‡ªğŸŸ

Pommes Frites has always been a good to in order for me to satisfy my fries cravings. They serve great portions at a good price and there are sooo many options for sauces. They have great service , allowing you to try any of the flavors before you make you order and then in a matter of moments, youre meal is ready. The atmosphere is like an old tavern feel , but the seats and space is limited. But overall I love this place!
Best potatoes ever
Best chips in the world
Fries are pretty much regular steak fries. No big difference to me. The dip selection is where it's at though. A few beer options don't hurt either.
Potatoes.  What more do you want?

From sauces to main ingredients, everything worked well. The interior styling is elegant without excess. The workers went further than required to help. I was amazed by the food quality. I'm definitely coming back for more.
Pommes Frites NYC is fantastic! Far better than the frites I had (at a highly rated place) in Brussels. Save yourself the flight and eat these awesome frites and sauces!
really good

Loved everything about this place! The fries, sauces, and concoction of different things!

Must try!

Used to go here on the east side. I orders just the regular, and asked for recommendation for sauce, the guy just pointed to the optionsâ€¦thanks a lot. It wasnâ€™t busy at all and I got old fries just sitting around. Not worth the $15 for fried potatoesâ€¦.

The poutine has more cheese and gravy than fries in it.. Resembles more of a gravy and cheese soup than poutine. Donâ€™t know what happened to this place but itâ€™s falling off in quality, and theyâ€™re getting very cheap with condiments and fries..
The one and only. Not sure you need the 3 sauces for $5.50, because their ketchup/onion/mayo concoction is just as good. But I would do the herbs and parnesan, though. Have not tried the poutine!
I've been coming here w/ my family since I was a little kid back when they were located on 2nd ave. They're among the best fries and sauces in NYC! This place is legendary!
Great stop for a snack of traditional frittes with sauce.  First time was in a food tour, now itâ€™s a staple when I need a break and a bite.

Want a casual place for Belgian fries? If so, then this is your place. Not only are the fries crispy on the outside and hot on the inside, they have more than 10 different dipping sauces that include spice, heat and flavor. While the place is small inside, it makes up for it in big flavor and a very helpful and friendly staff. We will be back ...
I was there after getting an low taper fade in Adrian's restaurant with mango matcha mustard labubus and my mother ate fries thereâœŒï¸âœŒï¸âœŒï¸ğŸ¤£ğŸ¤£ğŸ¤£ğŸ¤£ğŸ¥€ğŸ¥€

On cherchait Ã  manger une poutine, google nous a trouvÃ© ce petit resto belge sympa mais vraiment petit, 4 tables Ã  l'intÃ©rieur et une en "terrasse" qui correspond Ã  un petit bout du trottoir devant.
La poutine ici se compose de frites avec ce qui semble Ãªtre de l'emmental fondu et une sauce marron qui me fait penser furieusement Ã  l'aspect du boeuf bourguignon avec un autre goÃ»t (pas le goÃ»t du vin).
Repas bon et agrÃ©able accompagnÃ© d'une Hoegaarden au goÃ»t Ã©tonnamment fruitÃ©.

Pommes Frites on MacDougal is one of those spots that just makes you happy the moment you walk in. Itâ€™s simple, itâ€™s casual, and itâ€™s all about the fries. Belgian fries arenâ€™t just regular fries theyâ€™re twice fried, which makes them extra crisp on the outside while staying soft and fluffy inside. The tradition goes back centuries in Belgium, where fried potatoes became a staple street food and part of everyday life. Unlike the skinny fast-food style â€œFrench fries,â€ these are hearty, golden, and meant to be savored slowly, usually in a paper cone with sauce dripping down the sides.

The menu here is heaven for anyone who loves dipping sauces. There are so many to choose from that it almost feels like its own adventure just picking one. This time I went with the Aji Verde, a Peruvian green sauce that was creamy, tangy, and had a nice spicy kick from the chili peppers. The cilantro and feta gave it that fresh but bold balance that paired perfectly with the fries. Honestly, it turned a simple cone of potatoes into something way more exciting.

The space itself has a fun, cozy vibe wooden walls, casual seating, and the kind of atmosphere where you can just hang out with friends or grab a quick snack before heading somewhere else in the Village. The fries come out piping hot and feel like the kind of treat you could eat on their own or with a side of poutine if youâ€™re extra hungry. I was already stuffed from earlier, so I kept it simple this time, but thatâ€™s the beauty of Pommes Frites, you can go small or go big depending on your mood.

Itâ€™s the kind of place that reminds you why Belgian fries have their own culture and reputation crispy, fluffy, generous, and best with sauce running down your fingers. Iâ€™ll definitely be back to try more flavors and maybe finally get the poutine everyone raves about.

You MUST come here! Pommes Frites in New York is one of my favorite spots to visit whenever I come from South Florida. It is such a fun and unique concept with perfectly crispy french fries served in different sizes and an incredible variety of dipping sauces. SO MANY to choose. The flavors are creative and make this simple idea feel really special.
They have been around forever and it is always a must stop for me when I am in the city. Totally recommended for anyone who loves fries and wants to try something different in New York.

Fries were ok, not like in Belgium where it is extra crispy on outside,  creamy inside and freshly peeled and cut.  Similar to what
I would get at Red Robin.  Service great.

The fries were really good and theyâ€™re made fresh to order. They had the right amount of crisp on the outside and cooked perfectly on the inside. Thereâ€™s also a lot of sauces to choose from. The Frites Sauce was really good.

I visited the Netherlands in the spring of 1999 as a senior in high school, falling in love with Belgian style fries. Forget the ketchup - that's for little kids - try one of the amazing sauces and enjoy a delightful, if maybe a little carb-full, treat, snack, or meal. I wish more places like this existed and more bars, restaurants, etc. took this much pride in their damn fries - the world would be a better, happier, and maybe a little chunkier, place!
Awesome poutine.. walked 30 blocks and didn't regret it ! Would definitely eat here again.
Been coming here for years...and prior location...for many years and it remains as good as ever.

Everyone from the busboy to the manager treats you well. Whoever headed the restaurant demonstrated real hospitality. The ambiance calms you, people working are sincere, and it creates a private world amid public streets. Each option delivers great flavor and fresh ingredients. I'm fully devoted to Pommes Frites.

Love this place been coming here since I was a kid and it hasnâ€™t changed one bit (excepting the sauce) the tre definition of ifs itâ€™s not broke donâ€™t fix it 10/10 will forever be coming back to this place
Delicious fries. Great people watching outside.
The french fries is amazing, extremely perfect! The sauces are amazing!
Perfectly cooked frites and the sauces are AWESOME
Garlic aioli was great but the fries became soggy quickly!!!
Awesome little gem! The atmosphere is rustic but very cool. Not a lot of seating, the food was great and the options were plentiful. Definitely will come back!
Everything was great. Fries were excellent. Service was quick.
I love this place so much!! The service and staff are amazing. I come all the way from the forgotten borough just to come here.
Great and friendly service by the guy at the counter. Delicious fries and many novel options of sauces to spice it up.
Amazing chunky cut fries. Their truffle fries with truffle mayo are so yummy
A great place to eat some seasoned fries with variety of sauces. It's located in a very small place and no much place to be seated. Their mango slushie is bomb.

Incredibly delicious fries fresh, hot, and served with dozens of amazing saucesâ€¦ oh, so good! And Christian was awesome super friendly, great service, and his sauce recommendations were totally on point! Chefâ€™s recommendation!!you wonâ€™t regret it!
Best fries in the city

Smacks McDonald's fries anytime!
Great spot for frites!! The garlic aloi sauce works so well with fries. They have poutine, but it needs to be shared with others. If you are visiting solo just get the regular size trust it's enough even for 2 people.
Cheers to having a piece of Belgium ğŸŸ!! Better than McDonald's.....

Visited Pommes Frites on June 30, 2025, at approximately 7:10 PM. The fries were undeniably the highlightâ€”fresh, hot, crispy, and served in generous portions. They definitely live up to the hype when it comes to flavor and texture.

However, the customer service left a lot to be desired. The male employee working the counter at that time showed no personality and came across as borderline rude. There was no greeting, no eye contact, and no effort to make us feel welcomed or appreciated. It was a surprisingly cold interaction that took away from an otherwise enjoyable food experience.

Great fries, but hospitality mattersâ€”and unfortunately, it was missing during our visit.
This place has the best sauces! Fries are piping hot and have the perfect soft/crunch ratio. Aji Verde sauce was our BEST! In our four day trip we came twice.

I love coming here they have the best French fries in New York City. Every time Iâ€™m in the area, this is my go to spot for great fries. I took a picture of what was leftâ€¦ it was too delicious not to devour! If youâ€™re in the area, definitely check them out!

I got the regular poutine and it wasn't amazing, just fine and a bit bland tasting. Maybe I should've gotten the special?

I thought the interior and exterior was charming and well thought out, despite the limited space. I might go again to try other options.

Such a unique restaurant! I was initially very curious about why a place selling mostly fries was so crowded. But the key here is the large variety of sauces and the texture of the fries that you don't get at other restaurants. We were confused about which sauces to pick and the guy behind the counter was kind enough to suggest their best selling ones - roasted garlic aioli, sweet mango chutney and the spicy aji verde.

This place serves fries like youâ€™d find in the Netherlands or Europeâ€”crispy on the outside, fluffy on the inside, and served with a huge variety of sauces. The Black Truffle Mayo is a must-try, especially with the large-size fries.

The interior has a medieval-style decor, but they play modern pop music, which is kind of a weird mixâ€”but in a cool way.

The menu is all about their signature fries, double-fried for that perfect texture, with over 30 dipping sauces ranging from classics like roasted garlic aioli to more unique options like Vietnamese pineapple.

Itâ€™s a small spot but super popular with both locals and tourists. Great for a quick, delicious snack, and theyâ€™re open lateâ€”until midnight on weekdays and 2 AM on weekendsâ€”so perfect for late-night cravings!

I was so excited to find this place while wandering the area on a Sunday afternoon. There is nothing quite like delicious, hot French fries, and the added bonus of a variety of dipping sauces made this over the top perfect.

Fries were unbelievably good! The cheese sauce was a favorite, and the honey mustard and bbq were good as well. The black truffle was pretty heavy on the garlic, so I would not order that one again next time.

Highly recommend!!

Frites were delicious! Came out pipping hot but took a little too long to get to us (even when the place wasnâ€™t busy) so just be prepared to wait a little. Loved all the sauces so absolutely try at least a choke of them!

I got the parmesean peppercorn, rosmary and garlic, and aji verde sauces. All of the sauces were very good but the fries were average. Also very expensive for the little sauce they give. I would give 4.5 if i could since the aji verde was so good.

Staff was really polite and nice. The fries were good and had a large variety of sauces. My family decided to get a large order and 3 sauces ( samurai ketchup, cheddar cheese and frittes mayo).

The fries were a little underwhelming, but would still recommend folks to try them and sample taste the sauces.

The tables were cool since you could put your fries in the hole and snack easily.

I first visited Pommes Frites with a close Canadian friend from work a couple of years ago, during my first year in the city. We were on a mission to try their poutine, and we were not disappointed. My friend agreed it tasted like the real deal, and it was a great introduction to authentic poutine for me.

Located near Washington Square Park, Pommes Frites is as a beloved East Village staple and has a rich history of serving up authentic Belgian-style fries to both locals and tourists. The fries are made fresh, and the service is always friendly. This tiny nook should feature on any must-do food list for NYC. The space combines old-world ambience and decor with an upbeat pop soundtrack (mostly Dua Lipa during my last visit).

Theyâ€™ve also expanded their menu to include fresh smoothies, which is a great addition to balance out the fries and poutine. This time, I tried their Poutine Special, topped with wild mushrooms, roasted garlic, cherry tomatoes, and fresh herbs. Even the regular portion is generous, so if youâ€™re dining solo, be prepared to possibly take some home. Most people swear by their double truffle frites, and love experimenting with the wide array of sauces and toppings they offer here. Whatever you decide, you canâ€™t go wrong!

For anyone looking for a satisfying and delicious comfort food experience, Pommes Frites is a must-visit. The combination of simple base menu options, quality ingredients, unique topping- and flavor- combinations, a storied past, and a relaxed atmosphere makes this a standout spot in the city.
The quality as well as the taste of the fries & the sauce was too good should definitely give a try . Fries with goat cheese, Smokey jalapeÃ±o sauce & truffle mayo are must try sauces ğŸ‘ğŸ»ğŸ’¯

A great restaurant that sells authentic Belgium fries while also having an ancient medieval atmosphere. The cashier was great and gave a plethora of sauces as samples, there were so many great sauces but certain sauces stood out more than others.

After getting the fresh fries inside a cone, I sat down at the table and placed the cone into a cone holder. The fries were perfect thickness, perfect crispness, and salted just right. The sauces and medieval atmosphere made dining in a memorable experience. Would definitely recommend!

The frites or French fries were VERY tasty and perfectly crisp. They go a long way and are very filling. The sauces on the other hand leave a lot to be desired. While they are indeed fairly good, they were underwhelming. They didn't feel like anything you couldn't whip up yourself and often you couldn't taste some of the ingredients they were supposed to have in them. They also were overly expensive for how much you get and their quality.

The atmosphere was fun but cramped, dark, and not the most comfortable. It definitely feels like being wedged into an underground wooden keg style room. Lots of dark wood. The service is simply counter service which isn't anything special.

An enjoyable experience but honestly I wouldn't come back a second time.

Fantastic! I got truffle fries with samurai sauce. It was a perfect choice of sauce since the fries come with parmesan cheese on it. I got ketchup and mustard before tasting the sauce and never touched it. I would come back if I m nearby. I wish they have more selections for draft beer.

A really good fries shop with an extensive selection of sauces. The fries themselves are delicious, being crispy and well-salted. The sauces had good zing to them (my favorite being the Irish Curry).

My only discomfort was how tight and crowded it was but otherwise, a great spot.

I think the hype for this place has died down since I got my order at 6 PM without any line. The fries were pretty good: not the most amazing fried potatoes you'll ever eat, but way better than most. What makes this place amazing seems to be the sauce selection (note: you have to pay any that's not a basic condiment): I got the Aji Verde sauce and it was one of the best sauces I've had.

Their fries are to die for! I loved the fries by itself. The sauces take them to the next level. I was skeptical at first to try out a place that sells only fries. But boy, was I wrong! I am so glad I tried it! You should definitely give them a try!

Pommes Frites in Greenwich Village is an absolute adventure for french fry enthusiasts! Step into this fry haven and get ready for a culinary journey with their double-cooked, authentic Belgian fries. These fries are super fresh, perfectly crisp, and fried in clean oil, making each bite a delight.

But the real adventure begins with their incredible selection of over 30 mouth-watering sauces. Itâ€™s like a flavor playground where you can mix and match to discover your perfect combination. From classic choices to bold, exotic flavors, thereâ€™s something for every palate.

The place is so poults that at one point the place burned down due to a gas leak and the neighborhood pitched in to help the restaurant get back on its feet.

The atmosphere has a fun, Game of Thrones vibe, adding a touch of epic fantasy to your fry experience. If youâ€™re a fan of fries and sauces, Pommes Frites is your ultimate destination. This place is a must-visit in Greenwich Village for anyone looking to embark on a tasty and adventurous fry quest!

Hidden gem in west village close to Washington Square park, had the best Belgian fries here - thick and crunchy from the outside, perfect soft and sweet from the inside! They also have 30+ amazing sauces to go with the fries which just makes the experience so much fun!!

Delicious, if you love mayo. The pesto and mushroom sauces were, with no sign of being anything but pesto and chopped up mushroom, actually mostly made of mayo. The mushroom and pesto flavors were subtle, and only notable when trying to taste for it. Deeply disappointing

The fries and atmosphere of the place were as hoped for, but if I just wanted fries I wouldn't have gone here.

Located close to Washington sq Park, this fries place is famous locally and finally ticked off the list after 5 years. The place has a rustic ambiance while the vibes are perfect for the nearby NYU students

I ordered truffle fries with mushroom sauce. I went for the mini size but it was good enough for 2 people. The fries were really long and thick and way different than I ever had. The staff was happy to have me try some of the sauces before choosing one. The fries are topped with Parmesan cheese whereas took the sauce on side. I really loved the mushroom sauce as I thought it was unique.

Overall a great experience!

Gorgeous place with limited seating. The fries themselves were a little plain, especially given sauces are for additional costs. A little pricey, albiet the smallest size is still huge, but highly recommend trying once, esp the mushroom sauce!

The fries are crispy and nice. We got a double which was generous for two people. The sauces were disappointing. Maybe we didn't get the good ones but TLC, wild mushroom didn't have the flavors their names suggest. Curry ketchup especial was okay but honestly the ketchup is what elevates this over the other two sauces. We found that we mostly reached for plain ol' ketchup.

This is a beautiful, cozy restaurant serving amazing Frites. The service is quick and there is enough seating inside. The Frites are delicious, but could definitely do with a bit more salt and some chili powder. Some of the sauses do contain fish and/or eggs. So don't assume anything. But they have an allergy guide with them. So feel free to ask to look at it first before selecting. I also think 3 sauces are a lot for a regular sized fries. If you are also taking the free ketchup, I would stick to just 1-2 sauces.
We came here before the comedy cellar on the day of the Pride parade.  Even though it was crazy outside we found a set and had some amazing truffle fries!

This would be a great place to go with a large group of friends who all have different tastes. The menu is huge and you can customize your fries however you want. They always come out fast and fresh and thereâ€™s usually place inside to sit down, but the fries come in a container convenient to use while walking outside.

The fries were really great!
The portion was great, the fries have this amazing tangy smell, we were not sure it was pickle juice or what, but it was very appetizing. There are not many tables inside, but the place feels cozy. The decoration is resembling a medieval tavern. Great to sit and spend 15 minutes talking with friends!
